page.title: 06Westfield: Open-cast coal
page.content: Almost 3 square kilometres of our D- Block is coal board property, though much of that has been returned to grass by the{Coal Industry Estates.} The part where operations are still under way contains the{DISPOSAL POINT} Here the coal is separated from stone and gravel by a washing process. The coal is then graded for size before being sent to power stations and other consumers. Although the present phase of mining operations has come to an end, there is still a million tons of coal on the site to be processed in this way. In spite of the amount of work still to be done, workers are at this moment about to be made redundant. This move is causing a great deal of controversy locally. Audrey Henderson, Campbell Copeland, Claire Feeley, Robert Allan and Alison Glencross
